page.title: 11PUBLIC WORRIES
page.content: In local newspapers and talking to people we met,found 2 main worries; {gravel pits}and{gypsies.}Bradwell Aggregates Ltd.had bought Whitehouse Farm for sand,gravel deposits.People objected at local council planning meeting to company's plans.Objections raised: a) changing good farmland to quarries,b)noise ,c)roads in area inadequate to take heavy traffic. Application turned down,locals very worried about future.About 30 travelling families camped on Old London Road near Woodham Walter.Years of mistrust and bitterness between gypsies and local people.Gypsies fence gardens and rear animals on roadside. Main concern rubbish and scrap metal dumped by gypsies on roadside,mess left when they move,petty pilfering locally. Liason officer bringing locals and gypsies together.
